question.title: Make a plugin not inheritable per default
question.body:
Context:

I have a plugin with an aggregator goal which is supposed to be executed only once on the parent project (as mentionned in maven doc). We can have the following setup to make it works

If we have a parent project:

<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0">

  <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>
  <groupId>com.company.app</groupId>
  <artifactId>parent</artifactId>
  <version>1</version>

  <build>
    <plugins>
        <plugin>
            <groupId>com.company.app</groupId>
            <artifactId>plugin</artifactId>
            <execusions>
                <execusion>
                    <goals>goal</goals>
                    <inherited>false</inherited>
                <execusion>
            <execusions>
        </plugin>
    </plugins>
  </build>
 
  <modules>
    <module>child</module>
  </modules>

</project>

and a child:

<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0">
  <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>

  <parent>
      <groupId>com.company.app</groupId>
      <artifactId>parent</artifactId>
      <version>1</version>
  </parent>

  <artifactId>child</artifactId>

</project>

if we run mvn clean install on the parent it will execute the goal only on parent.

Problem:

Now if we have a grandparent and have multiple parent on which we want to execute non-recursively the goal we would think of having some config like this:

<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0">

  <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>
  <groupId>com.company.app</groupId>
  <artifactId>parent</artifactId>
  <version>1</version>

  <build>
    <pluginManagement>
        <plugin>
            <groupId>com.company.app</groupId>
            <artifactId>plugin</artifactId>
            <execusions>
                <execusion>
                    <goals>goal</goals>
                    <inherited>false</inherited>
                <execusion>
            <execusions>
        </plugin>
    </pluginManagement>
  </build>
 
  <modules>
    <module>parent1</module>
    <module>parent2</module>
    <module>parent3</module>
  </modules>

</project>

The problem of this is that the inherited is on the pluginManagement. So the configuration wont be passed to the child. But what we want it to pass it with the <inherited> so that if we use it on the parents, the goal will be not inherited by default.
